articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Indian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Indian President 
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Pratibha Devisingh Patil, president of India, as regards the case of terrorism in Mumbai that claimed heavy human losses. 
					 Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the Indian president, victims and bereaved families, Kim in the message hoped that the Indian president and government would eradicate the aftermath of the incident as early as possible and ensure social stability.

articles.title: Meetings of Voters Held to Nominate Candidates for Deputies
articles.content:
Meetings of Voters Held to Nominate Candidates for Deputies
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Meetings of voters for nominating candidates for deputies to provincial (municipality), city (district) and county people's assemblies took place in all parts of Korea.
					 The reporters said the elections would mark an occasion of glorifying President Kim Il Sung's feats performed in the nation-building and demonstrating the might of single-minded unity of the DPRK which has vigorously advanced, rallied close around General Secretary Kim Jong Il and advantages of the socialist system.
					
					 They noted that the DPRK has turned into a socialist power and the popular masses are exercising their rights as the master of the country and the society thanks to the Juche-oriented idea of building the state and the experienced and tested leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.  
					
					 They called on all the electors to make contributions to defending the immortal feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and making the DPRK eternally shine as the state of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The meetings explained the law on elections of deputies to people's assemblies at different levels.
					
					 They nominated officials, workers, farmers and intellectuals, who are ready to creditably discharge their duties as servants of the people with bounded loyal to Kim Jong Il, as candidates for deputies to the above-said local assemblies.
					
					 Speakers expressed full support for the candidates and vowed to make a positive contribution to cementing the people's power and realizing the cause of building a thriving nation by enthusiastically participating in the elections and voting for all of them.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak of S. Korea Denounced for Faking Up Spy Ring Case
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak of S. Korea Denounced for Faking Up Spy Ring Case 
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the North Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) issued a statement Monday to denounce the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea for suppressing people after faking up a spy ring case.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Lee group of traitors let the Intelligence Service and the Security Investigation Group search houses and offices of more than 10 personages in the fields of labor, political and academic circles on absurd charges that they conducted "espionage and built an underground party" at the "instruction of the north". They even arrested one of them by invoking the draconian "National Security Law."
					
					 The puppet regime seeks to suppress officials of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and even opposition parties, charging that they are linked with the "Iljin Association case."
					
					 They went the lengths of asserting that the Institute of University Education of south Korea, known to survey the university students' actions to have the registration fee halved and the registration fee issue, has something to do with the "Iljin Association case". They censored data, computers and even their handbooks. They also persecuted workers, youth and university students' organizations, including the Meeting of Workers for Democracy, the Jeju Youth Association and the Kangrung Youth Association, and walked individuals off by invoking the NSL.
					
					 It is a trite method used by the south Korean regime to fake up a spy ring case and intensify crackdown whenever it faces a ruling crisis.
					
					 The recent spy ring case and crackdown are aimed to calm down public resentment caused by the regime's domestic and foreign policy failure, economic depression, deteriorating livelihood and escalated anti-reunification confrontation with the north. They are also aimed to divert elsewhere people's criticism and prolong its remaining days.
					
					 They are a last-ditch effort to check the struggle of the progressive and democratic forces to punish the conservative regime at the "National Assembly" and "presidential" elections due next year and stay in power come what may.
					
					 South Koreans are becoming increasingly critical of the crackdown, describing it as a "last-ditch effort of the dictatorial regime" and "attempt to bring to collapse the progressive political parties and civic and public organizations before the elections."
					
					 The crackdown will only harden the people's pledge to bring down the conservative regime.
					
					 Various organizations and people of all social standings in south Korea should turn out in the struggle for the repeal of the NSL, the worst law violating human rights, and the release of those who were unreasonably put into custody and to overthrow the Lee regime seeking fascism and confrontation with the north by hatching all sorts of plots.
					
					 The Lee regime has pursued an unpopular rule and resorted to fascist suppression while hatching plots against the DPRK and fanning up atmosphere of war and confrontation since the very day of its seizure of power. It will not be able to escape stern punishment by history for those thrice-cursed crimes.

articles.title: Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed
articles.content:
Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting and a film show took place here Monday to mark the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 Present there on invitation was Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Cuba Solidarity Committee, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang were on hand.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin noted in his speech that 58 years ago the Cuban revolutionaries and patriotic people made the first gun-report of the revolution under the leadership of Fidel Castro Ruz. 
					
					 The Cuban people under the leadership of the Communist Party have advanced along the road of socialism while repulsing the imperialists' aggression and interference, he said.
					
					 He stressed that the Korean people would extend invariable support and solidarity to the Cuban people who maintain their revolutionary principle.
					
					 Jose Manuel Galego Montano said that the Cuban people deem it their pride to have had special relations with the Korean people under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Cuban people will as ever strengthen solidarity and cooperation with the Korean people, smashing the imperialists' aggression and provocative moves, the ambassador said.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012 by speeding up the economic construction.
					
					 After the meeting the participants watched a Cuban feature film.

articles.title: Vietnamese Foreign Ministry Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Vietnamese Foreign Ministry Delegation Arrives
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Press and Information Department of the Vietnamese Foreign Ministry led by Director General Nguyen Phuong Nga arrived here Monday.

articles.title: Drama "We Will Recollect Today" Staged before Full House
articles.content:
Drama "We Will Recollect Today" Staged before Full House
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Drama "We Will Recollect Today", laureate of Kim Il Sung Prize, is going on at the State Theatrical Theatre in Pyongyang before full house.
					 This drama was recently produced in the DPRK as one of monumental masterpieces in the era of Songun. 
					
					 The drama was enjoyed by officials in the fields of media, culture and arts and journalists and other media persons, creators and artistes on Sunday and Monday. 
					
					 The drama makes truthful artistic representation of the indomitable mental power and ardent patriotism displayed by the people of a mountainous county in the drive to implement the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on building medium- and small-scale hydraulic power stations during the arduous march in the 1990s.
					
					 It is flawless in all aspects ranging from establishing human relations to dramaturgy, stage decor, music effect and acting. It imbues the audience with a revolutionary outlook on the life and future to be possessed by the people in the era of Songun. 
					
					 It is evoking a lively response from among people for its high ideological and artistic value and strong emotional influence.

articles.title: DPRK Girl Wins Military Marathon Race
articles.content:
DPRK Girl Wins Military Marathon Race
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Kum Ok, a DPRK athlete, won the women's marathon race of the Fifth Military World Games held in Rio de Janeiro on July 17.   
					 She breasted the tape after two hours, thirty-five minutes and twenty-eight seconds to take the first gold medal in the games.

articles.title: Swimming Encouraged
articles.content:
Swimming Encouraged
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- July and August are months for maritime physical culture in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Korea, surrounded by sea on three sides, has favorable conditions for maritime physical culture. It also has many rivers, open-air baths, swimming pools and beach resorts.
					
					 Scenic bathing beaches in Majon, Thongchon, Ryongsupho and other areas on the east and west coasts of Korea are always crowded with people in summer days.
					
					 The swimming complex of Kim Il Sung University, Mangyongdae Pool, swimming pool of the Changgwang Health Complex and other swimming facilities in Pyongyang are also overcrowded with citizens seeking to spend a pleasant time in hot days.
					
					 During the months primary and secondary schools throughout the country often organize swimming contests.
					
					 River-crossing competitions are popular in schools in North Hamgyong, Kangwon and South Hwanghae Provinces.

articles.title: Koguryo People's Activities to Make Good Use of Sea
articles.content:
Koguryo People's Activities to Make Good Use of Sea
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Koguryo, the first feudal state of Korea (B.C. 277-A.D. 668), developed fisheries and naval forces and promoted foreign trade through sea routes.
					 The country had even deep-sea fishing fleets.
					
					 A Korean history book Samguksagi (Chronicles of the Three Kingdoms--Koguryo, Paekje and Silla) says that whale eyes were presented to the king in 288. 
					
					 Naval forces of Koguryo repelled seaborne invasions.
					
					 The naval forces were strengthened in the period of King Kwanggaetho (391-412) so that they could not only support the ground forces in battles but also conduct independent landing operations.
					
					 There are more than 80 historical records about maritime trade of Koguryo.
					
					 Koguryo people sailed to Japan and influenced its cultural development. 
					
					 Their creative activities for making good use of the sea added to the mightiness of the country.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (15)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (15)
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The potato liquor of Taehongdan is known to be a special product liked by the people for its technological index. It is associated with the efforts made by Kim Myong Hui, former researcher of the Fermentation Research Institute of the Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science, without expecting any reward.
					 It was in February of 2002 that General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Taehongdan Potato Processing Factory during which he praised her for devoting her all to supplying better foodstuffs to people while working at the factory for years.
					
					 She developed products of dozens of varieties needed for the development of the nation's biological engineering and successfully settled scientific and technological issues arising in producing nutritious processed potato products of Korean style. She performed distinguished merits in the work to study and develop drinks peculiar to the country.
					
					 In order to repay the leader's loving care, she is expanding her research achievements to contribute to improving the standard of people's living, keeping pace with him for the forced march.
					
					 She is now discharging her duty as a room chief of the branch academy.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates an article to the 25th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Some Problems of Education in the Juche Idea."
					 The work, published on July 15, 1986, fully proves the scientific accuracy and revolutionary nature of the Juche idea, the guiding idea of the Workers' Party of Korea, and its originality and universality. It also clarifies such important theoretical and practical issues as properly understanding the basic principle of the Party's ideological work and advantages of the socialist system.
					
					 The education in the Juche idea provides a sure guarantee for consolidating in every way the single-minded unity between the Party and the revolutionary ranks centered on the headquarters of the revolution. It also makes it possible for the army and people to firmly defend the Korean-style socialist system with transparent anti-imperialist class awareness in any circumstances, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 It serves as a main source of strength to give full play to the mental power of the popular masses in the effort for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 All the people are fully displaying the spirit of devotedly defending the leader in the building of a thriving socialist country, greatly proud of having reelected Kim Jong Il to the top post of the Party and revolution.
					
					 Immensely high is the determination of all the servicepersons and people to safeguard the Korean-style socialist system of Juche at the risk of their lives.
					
					 There are no difficulties insurmountable and no fortress unconquerable for the people armed with the transparent idea that man is responsible for his own destiny and capable of hewing it out. This has been proved by the on-going drive for a great surge.
					
					 Korean-style socialism remains unshakable in any storm and stress when all the army and people are more firmly equipped with the Juche idea and thoroughly apply it to the revolution and construction, the article concludes.

articles.title: S. Korea's "White Paper on Human Rights of North" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korea's "White Paper on Human Rights of North" under Fire  
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The "2011 white paper on human rights of the north" recently released by the Institute for Unification Studies of south Korea is an anti-DPRK document full of fraud, deception and fabrication, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined commentary.
					 It was an unpardonable politically-motivated provocation to the DPRK for the Institute to publish the white paper, the commentary said, adding that this reveals the criminal attempt to realize the traitorous ambition for "unifying systems."
					
					 The commentary went on:
					
					 Man is regarded as the most valuable being in the DPRK under Korean-style socialist system centered on the popular masses. It is a genuine system for the people guaranteeing all members of the society political freedom and rights.
					
					 There are real human rights abuses in south Korea which is under military occupation by foreign forces and fascist dictatorship.
					
					  What is at issue is why the puppet group so frantically kicks up anti-DPRK "human rights" row, even lost to shame. The group seeks to tarnish the image of the DPRK and realize its ambition for "unifying systems" even by spreading lies and hatching plots.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group should clearly understand that its attempt to bring down the dignified system in the DPRK through the sordid "human rights" smear campaign is as foolish an act as trying to eclipse the sunlight with a palm.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group's anti-DPRK "human rights" row will only precipitate its miserable ruin.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Unpopular Nature of S. Korean Conservative Regime
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Unpopular Nature of S. Korean Conservative Regime
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea regards people as the target of its politics and leaves no means untried to achieve its sinister political aims, while oppressing and exploiting them, says the Rodong Sinmun newspaper Monday.  
					 As for its economic policy, it is based on the American-style "market-almighty concept" and "neo-liberalism", the daily says in a bylined article, adding:
					
					 After coming to power the conservative group reneged on its "commitment" to pursue "a policy for common people." But it formed the "government" with millionaires and kingpins of scandals and followed an "economic policy depending on plutocrats". Consequently, it fanned up economic crisis and brought the people bigger misfortune and sufferings. It has pushed forward only unpopular policies including the projects for improving four large rivers, "educational autonomy" and "privatization of the public sector," all opposed by the people. The group does so because its support base is the exploiting class such as plutocrats. 
					
					 The group maintains its power with political funds it gets from plutocrats for patronizing them and protecting their interests. After taking power the group reduced taxes of the plutocrats while increasing taxes of common and middle-class people. This is a typical example proving its political tie-up with the plutocrats. 
					
					 The widening gap between the rich and the poor in south Korea is attributable to the corrupt social system where foreign forces, reactionary ruling quarters and exploiters lord it over. It is this unpopular policy of the Lee group that creates social evils resulting from the above-said gap. 
					
					 The rulers dominating the people and violating their dignity and interests, backed by outsiders, are fated to meet ruin. This is the truth proven by history.

articles.title: US, S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage Joint War Maneuvers against DPRK
articles.content:
US, S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage Joint War Maneuvers against DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers are planning to stage Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises from August 16 to 26, according to south Korean MBC.
					 This plan was announced by the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" on July 18.
					
					 Hurled into the exercises will be more than 30,000 U.S. troops including those from overseas bases and huge puppet armed forces.
					
					 Under the pretext of "annual exercises" the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces have staged the maneuvers across south Korea every year with latest nuclear war hardware and aggression forces and even civilians involved. The aggressive nature of the maneuvers has already been brought to light as they are nuclear war exercises based on the scenario for preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 They should stop at once such dangerous plan.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Violating Workers' Vital Rights
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Violating Workers' Vital Rights
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Members of the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea launched an indefinite hunger strike on July 14 in protest against the puppet authorities' violation of the vital rights of the workers.
					 They declared they began the strike to denounce the "government" and the company sides for their unreasonable lay-off and suppression of trade unions and demand the guarantee of workers' vital rights together with the chairman of the Confederation of Trade Unions who started the hunger strike on July 13.
					
					 The DLP would fight it out in solidarity with all the workers struggling for the genuine life of the people, they stated.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Faking up Conspiratorial Case
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Faking up Conspiratorial Case
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of south Korea, including the Inchon Headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions and the People's Solidarity for the Repeal of the "National Security Law", held a press conference outside the puppet Intelligence Service on July 15 denouncing the authorities for their politically-motivated suppression.
					 Speakers at the conference blasted the authorities for cracking down on ten odd workers and citizens involved in the reunification movement on the strength of the NSL on charges that they conducted activities after organizing a spy ring called "Iljin Association".
					
					 We cannot repress resentment at the authorities' recent action as it is a conspiratorial case to put down the people's actions, they said, adding: The authorities are seriously mistaken if they think they can tide over the ruling crisis by invoking the NSL.
					
					 They demanded the authorities stop the indiscriminate investigation and acts of cooking up cases and repeal the NSL at once.
					
					 We will fight it out, they declared, saying they could never remain an onlooker to the reality in which innocent people are labeled criminals.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Army Tank Overturned in Rehearsal
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Army Tank Overturned in Rehearsal
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- A tank of the south Korean puppet army was overturned in Popwon-ri, Phaju City, Kyonggi Province during the war exercises against the DPRK on July 14, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 A soldier aboard the tank died.

articles.title: Suppression of Trade Unions Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Trade Unions Protested in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a candlelight rally in Seoul on July 15 in protest against the "government" authorities' suppression of trade unions.
					 The Confederation accused the management sides of the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd., and the Yusong Enterprise of dismissing and cracking down on unionists in the plea of lay-off system.
					
					 It also pointed out that the prosecution's investigation into members of the Teachers Union and the Government Employees' Union by linking them with the Democratic Labor Party is evidently aimed at trade unions.
					
					 The organization demanded that the authorities stop the suppression of trade unions and ensure the political right of unionists.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from Personage of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Personage of Democratic Congo
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Prof. Kamwiziku Octave, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, on June 27 presented to General Secretary Kim Jong Il a letter on behalf of the participants in the national seminar on the Juche idea held in Democratic Congo.
					 The Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung is a universal trend of ideology of progressive mankind as it is the revolutionary theory, the man-centered outlook on the world, to realize independence of the people, the letter said.
					
					 The Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il is a powerful political mode that regards the military affairs as the most important state affair and helps defend the country, revolution and socialism and push forward the overall socialist construction with the army as hardcore and main force, it noted.
					
					 The vitality of the Juche idea and the Songun politics has been clearly proved in the stirring reality of the DPRK, a socialist fortress winning victory after victory in the confrontation with the imperialist forces, it said.
					
					 We support the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea on convening a world conference on the Juche idea in Pyongyang in April 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, the historic event and common holiday of progressive mankind, it noted.
					
					 The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and Juche idea followers of Democratic Congo will take an active part in the work to prepare the conference and intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea, the Songun idea and thus support the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation and achieve national reunification, the letter concluded.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Foreign Parties
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Foreign Parties
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Organs of foreign political parties carried special write-ups on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Pasason, organ of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, on July 6 carried an article titled "Tribute to President Kim Il Sung" with a portrait of smiling President.
					
					 It noted the President's greatest wish was to make the Korean people live well with no more to desire in the world.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's leadership over the building of a thriving nation is directed to turning the lifelong desire and ideal of the President into a brilliant reality, it said.
					
					 Al Baath, organ of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, on July 7 carried a special write-up under the title "On the 17th Anniversary of Demise of President Kim Il Sung". 
					
					 It said the President gave a scientific exposition to all the issues arising in realizing global independence, strengthening the Non-Aligned Movement and South-South cooperation and establishing a fair international order.
					
					 He actively supported the people of various countries in their struggle for national liberation against the imperialism, it stressed.
					
					 Friheten, organ of the Communist Party of Norway, said in an article on July 6 that the President worked hard for the victorious advance of the human cause of independence and the socialist cause till the last moments of his life.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Indian Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Indian Newspapers
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Indian newspapers issued articles with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung between July 4 and 6 on the 17th anniversary of his demise.
					 New Delhi Times noted in an article the President rescued the Korean people from the destiny of colonial slavery and put forward them as the master of the state and society and the most dignified and happiest people.
					
					 The President regarded the people's happiness as his own, the article said, adding dwelling houses, shops, factories and farms visited by him are in all parts of the DPRK. 
					
					 Science Technology and Education News said in an article that the Korean people are looking forward to 2012. It is their firm determination to glorify the centenary of birth of the President as the greatest holiday and the great auspicious jubilee in human history, it noted.
					
					 Public News in an article praised the undying feats of the President who advanced the idea and theory, strategy and tactics for the victorious advance of global independence, clarifying the way ahead of progressive mankind in their struggle against imperialism and hegemony.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Life Introduced by Organs of Ecuador, Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Life Introduced by Organs of Ecuador, Democratic Congo
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The Voluntad Publishing House of Ecuador and the News Agency of Democratic Congo commemorated the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The publishing house on July 8 carried an article titled "Political Idea of President Kim Il Sung" with a portrait of smiling President and a photo of his statue on Mansu Hill.
					
					 The article said: The President's life was one of total dedication to the people. It was his political creed to believe in the people as in Heaven. He put forward the people as the master of the state and society.
					
					 The President waged hard-fought anti-Japanese armed struggle to liberate the country and led the revolution and construction to victory by regarding the people as teacher and relying on their strength.
					
					 The News Agency of Democratic Congo on July 11 carried in a bulletin and posted on the Internet homepage an article introducing the shining revolutionary life of the President who devoted his all to the country and the people and the cause of global independence.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Bulletin Marks Month of Anti-US Joint Struggle
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Bulletin Marks Month of Anti-US Joint Struggle
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi Group for the Study of the Songun Policy on July 12 issued a bulletin titled "Dialogue or Confrontation" to mark the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The article said:
					
					 The hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. have lasted for over half a century.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists ignited a war in June 1950 against the DPRK, which was less than two years old. This was a typical example of the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					 Whenever opportunities presented themselves including the Pueblo case, EC-121 large spy plane case, the Panmunjom case and the nuclear crisis in the Korean Peninsula, the U.S. stood in confrontation with the DPRK by mobilizing armed forces for aggression including nuclear-powered aircraft carriers.
					
					 If a war breaks out in the Korean Peninsula where huge armed forces including nukes stand in acute confrontation, it will go over to a thermonuclear war that has never been experienced by humankind.
					
					 It is the consistent policy of the DPRK to replace the armistice agreement with a peace one, normalize the DPRK-U.S. relations and make the Korean Peninsula a nuclear-free peace zone through dialogue.
					
					 Had the U.S. abandoned its anachronistic confrontation policy, the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. would have already been defused and the denuclearization of the peninsula smoothly realized.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Iran and Slovenia on July 11 agreed to strengthen bilateral cooperation in the fields of science, culture and sports.
					 Meanwhile, Botswana and Zimbabwe recently signed a Memorandum of Understanding for cooperation in the control and eradication of foot and mouth disease.

articles.title: China Strives to Enhance Role of Officials of Basic Organizations in Rural Areas
articles.content:
China Strives to Enhance Role of Officials of Basic Organizations in Rural Areas 
Beijing, July 17 (KCNA) -- The general offices of the Central Committee of the Communist Party and the State Council of China recently published "Some regulations for officials of basic organs in rural areas to carry out their duties with integrity".
					 The regulations are aimed to step up the building of a regulatory system to combat corruption and ensure integrity, round off the code of conduct of the officials of the basic organizations in the rural areas and help them carry out their duties with integrity.

articles.title: Chinese Party Official Refers to Party Role
articles.content:
Chinese Party Official Refers to Party Role
Beijing, July 17 (KCNA) -- The secretary of the Shanghai Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China referred to  the role of the party at the 15th plenary meeting of the 9th municipal committee of the CPC held between July 11 and 12. 
					  The party plays a key role in strengthening social management and bringing about innovations, he said, adding that in other words it depends on whether the party is trusted by people or not. 
					
					 The party should focus efforts on settling difficult issues concerning important fields and links, the issues which evoke people's

articles.title: Eurasian Union Will Start Work from 2013: Russian PM
articles.content:
Eurasian Union Will Start Work from 2013: Russian PM 
Moscow, July 17 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said at a recent interview that the Eurasian Union would start its work from 2013. 
					 Full-scale preparations are now under way and a declaration of the union would be signed next year, he said.

articles.title: Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan Discuss Operation of Unitary Economic Lever
articles.content:
Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan Discuss Operation of Unitary Economic Leve
Moscow, July 17 (KCNA) -- The prime ministers of Russia, Belarus and Kazakhstan at a meeting in Moscow on July 12 discussed the operation of unitary economic lever among the three nations from January 1, 2012.
					 At the meeting, they referred to the significance of abrogating the customs formalities within the sphere of the customs union. They stressed the need to make full preparations for the entry of the three nations into a new legal lever and provide equal conditions to the business hosts of the three nations inside the unitary economic lever.

articles.title: Montsame News Agency Celebrates Its 90th Birthday
articles.content:
Montsame News Agency Celebrates Its 90th Birthday 
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The Mongolian national news agency, Montsame, celebrated its 90th anniversary on Friday.
					 Representatives from many foreign news agencies attended the celebrations.
					
					 The general director of Montsame reviewed the 90-year history of the agency and expressed the will to develop the friendly cooperation relationship between Montsame and foreign news agencies.

articles.title: Energy Prices Rise in EU Member Nations
articles.content:
Energy Prices Rise in EU Member Nations
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- In June, energy prices in the euro zone jumped by 10.9 percent year on year, according to the European Union's (EU) statistics office Eurostat on Thursday.

articles.title: Serious Unemployment in US
articles.content:
Serious Unemployment in US
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The unemployment is getting serious in the United States due to the continued economic stagnation.
					 The Labor Department said on July 14 that the figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 405,000 in the week ending July 9.

articles.title: US Department of Defense Attacked by Foreign Intelligence Service
articles.content:
US Department of Defense Attacked by Foreign Intelligence Service
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) - The U.S. Department of Defense was attacked by a foreign intelligence service.
					 The U.S. deputy defense secretary admitted that a foreign intelligence service stole 24,000 files from a U.S. defense contractor in March this year. 
					
					 The recent hacking was reported to be the biggest cyber attack on the Defense Department.

articles.title: Afghans Condemn Killing of Civilians by NATO Forces
articles.content:
Afghans Condemn Killing of Civilians by NATO Forces
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of Afghans staged a protest demonstration in Khost City, the capital of Khost Province to condemn the killing of civilians by NATO-led troops on Thursday.
					 Chanting anti-U.S., anti-NATO slogans, the demonstrators alleged that NATO-led troops opened fire and killed six civilians and injured two others.
					
					 They strongly demanded an immediate stop to the killing of civilians.

articles.title: Afghan Civilian Casualties on Steady Increase
articles.content:
Afghan Civilian Casualties on Steady Increase
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Civilian deaths are increasing in Afghanistan due to military operations conducted by the U.S.-led NATO forces under the signboard of "counter-terrorism".
					 Due to military operations and violence, the number of civilian deaths in the country reached 1,462 in the first six months of 2011, an increase of 15 percent over the same period of 2010, the UN said on Thursday.

articles.title: Crimes Rife in Japan
articles.content:
Crimes Rife in Japan
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- All kinds of crimes are rife in Japan, driving people into constant uneasiness and horror.
					 711 837 crimes were committed in the first half of the year, the National Police Agency said Thursday.

articles.title: Hailstorm Hits Slovenia, Austria
articles.content:
Hailstorm Hits Slovenia, Austria
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Recently Slovenia suffered from hailstorm that hit its eastern area.
					 Hailstones as big as eggs destroyed roofs of hundreds of dwelling houses while damaging a lot of crops.
					
					 Hailstorm also stroke the southern area of Austria, cutting off transmission lines to stop electricity supply to tens of thousands of flats.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il ve el concierto de la Orquesta Unhasu
articles.content:
Drama "We Will Recollect Today" Staged before Full House
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Drama "We Will Recollect Today", laureate of Kim Il Sung Prize, is going on at the State Theatrical Theatre in Pyongyang before full house.
					 This drama was recently produced in the DPRK as one of monumental masterpieces in the era of Songun. 
					
					 The drama was enjoyed by officials in the fields of media, culture and arts and journalists and other media persons, creators and artistes on Sunday and Monday. 
					
					 The drama makes truthful artistic representation of the indomitable mental power and ardent patriotism displayed by the people of a mountainous county in the drive to implement the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on building medium- and small-scale hydraulic power stations during the arduous march in the 1990s.
					
					 It is flawless in all aspects ranging from establishing human relations to dramaturgy, stage decor, music effect and acting. It imbues the audience with a revolutionary outlook on the life and future to be possessed by the people in the era of Songun. 
					
					 It is evoking a lively response from among people for its high ideological and artistic value and strong emotional influence.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de condolencias a su homologo indio
articles.content:
Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting and a film show took place here Monday to mark the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 Present there on invitation was Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Cuba Solidarity Committee, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang were on hand.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin noted in his speech that 58 years ago the Cuban revolutionaries and patriotic people made the first gun-report of the revolution under the leadership of Fidel Castro Ruz. 
					
					 The Cuban people under the leadership of the Communist Party have advanced along the road of socialism while repulsing the imperialists' aggression and interference, he said.
					
					 He stressed that the Korean people would extend invariable support and solidarity to the Cuban people who maintain their revolutionary principle.
					
					 Jose Manuel Galego Montano said that the Cuban people deem it their pride to have had special relations with the Korean people under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Cuban people will as ever strengthen solidarity and cooperation with the Korean people, smashing the imperialists' aggression and provocative moves, the ambassador said.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012 by speeding up the economic construction.
					
					 After the meeting the participants watched a Cuban feature film.

articles.title: Reuniones por recomendacion de candidatos a diputados
articles.content:
DPRK Girl Wins Military Marathon Race
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Kum Ok, a DPRK athlete, won the women's marathon race of the Fifth Military World Games held in Rio de Janeiro on July 17.   
					 She breasted the tape after two hours, thirty-five minutes and twenty-eight seconds to take the first gold medal in the games.

articles.title: APRP denuncia a la banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Indian President 
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Pratibha Devisingh Patil, president of India, as regards the case of terrorism in Mumbai that claimed heavy human losses. 
					 Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the Indian president, victims and bereaved families, Kim in the message hoped that the Indian president and government would eradicate the aftermath of the incident as early as possible and ensure social stability.

articles.title: Actos por el mes de solidaridad con el pueblo cubano
articles.content:
US, S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage Joint War Maneuvers against DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers are planning to stage Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises from August 16 to 26, according to south Korean MBC.
					 This plan was announced by the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" on July 18.
					
					 Hurled into the exercises will be more than 30,000 U.S. troops including those from overseas bases and huge puppet armed forces.
					
					 Under the pretext of "annual exercises" the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces have staged the maneuvers across south Korea every year with latest nuclear war hardware and aggression forces and even civilians involved. The aggressive nature of the maneuvers has already been brought to light as they are nuclear war exercises based on the scenario for preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 They should stop at once such dangerous plan.
